item.title: Blogging for music motivation
item.dc:creator: Matt Crump
item.description:
I had some time at the end of my semester to play piano more than usual. This semester that meant I actually played the piano, instead of not playing the piano.

Clearly I need to make time for more piano. I’m hoping this blog will keep me somewhat organized and motivated to stay on target.

The blog is built with quarto, and this post is just changing the structure a little bit so that each post is it’s own post, rather than a bunch of posts on a single page.

item.title: Dolphin Dance
item.dc:creator: Matt Crump
item.description:
” Herbie Hancock’s dolphin dance with a bunch of synthesizers” - LCM_Dreamshaper_v7

Have been messing about with Herbie Hancock’s “Dolphin Dance” on the piano for a while.

Had a clear day to try some mixer mimicking. Plan was to develop my own voicings for everything, but mix them similar to the Maiden Voyage recording…and then jam it.

What happened:

  • Recorded the Hancock version into Ableton
  • Located BPM
  • Voices
    • Rhodes
    • Moog matriarch bass lines
    • MPC drums
    • OB-6 horns
  • For each voice, play with the original record. Keep recording in a loop using Ableton comping lanes
  • Fix messes by sampling in comping lanes/ explore have fun with fixing the mess
  • Duplicate the head, then solo overtop for a bit
  • Mix it down.
  • Try some final mixing touches.
